title: Camera Trap Data Package Profile
description: This is the profile of standardized camera trap data package.

organization.description: Basic information about an organization related to this data package.

taxon_id.description: Taxon ID of the species according to a taxonomic reference list defined by `taxon_id_reference`.

vernacular_name.description: Common name of the species, preferably in English.

count.description: Number of observations for that species in the data package.

multimedia_access.description: Information about the accessibilty of the multimedia files listed in `multimedia.csv`.

remote.description: `true` if multimedia files are stored remotely (e.g. in the cloud) and `false` if these are part of the data package. In the latter case, relative paths in `multimedia.csv` start from the root of the data package.

public.description: `true` if URLs to multimedia files in `multimedia.csv` are publicly accessible. Additional information about the required authentication process should be provided in the `auth_type` field if `false`.

auth_type.description: Type of authentication required to get access to multimedia files.

organizations.description: List of organizations related to this data package.

project.description: Camera trap project that generated the data in this data package.

acronym.description: Short and human-readable identifier of the project.

description.description: Description of the project, ideally expressed in Markdown format. To describe the data package itself, use <https://specs.frictionlessdata.io/data-package/#description>.

sampling_design.description: Type of a sampling design/layout. The values are based on Wearn & Glover-Kapfer (2017, <https://doi.org/10.13140/RG.2.2.23409.17767>), pages 80-82: `simple random`: random distribution of sampling locations; `systematic random`: random distribution of sampling locations, but arranged in a regular pattern; `clustered random`: random distribution of sampling locations, but clustered in arrays; `experimental`: non-random distribution aimed to study an effect, including the before-after control-impact (BACI) design; `targeted`: non-random distribution optimized for capturing specific target species (often using various bait types); `opportunistic`: opportunistic camera trapping (usually with a small number of cameras).

animal_types.description: Type of observed animals. `marked` indicates specific animal individuals can be recognized.

bait_use.description: Type of bait (if any) that was used with cameras.

classification_level.description: Information about a focal level of the classification process. `sequence`: classifications (i.e. rows in `observations.csv` table) are provided at a sequence level (multiple multimedia files can be part of one sequence); `multimedia`: classifications are available for each single multimedia file.

sequence_interval.description: Maximum number of seconds between timestamps of successive multimedia files to be considered part of a single sequence and be assigned the same `sequence_id`.

methods.description: Description of the methodology used to collect and process data.

references.description: List of references related to the project.

_id.description: Internal attribute of data management system or data packages catalogue: ID of the project.

spatial.description: Spatial coverage for this data package specified as GeoJSON.

temporal.description: Temporal coverage for this data package, based on the included deployments

start.description: Start date of the first deployment, as an ISO 8601 formatted string (`YYYY-MM-DD`).

end.description: End date of the last (completed) deployment, as an ISO 8601 formatted string (`YYYY-MM-DD`).

taxonomic.description: Taxonomic coverage for this data package. It is based on a set of unique values from `scientific_name` field in `observations.csv` table.

taxon_id_reference.description: URL of the source (reference list) of the `taxon_id`s in taxonomic coverage.

_platform_title.description: Internal attribute of data management or repository system: platform name.

_platform_path.description: Internal attribute of data management or repository system: platform URL.

_platform_version.description: Internal attribute of data management or repository system: platform version.

_platform_package_id.description: Internal attribute of data management or repository system: package ID.
